reviews.review: ESTA BUENO JUGALO

I was born long after half-Life earned its place as a industry-shifting experience, and as I experience HL for the first time, the revolutionary aspects aren't as prominent to me as some of the more dated aspects of the experience. Half Life wasn't a blast. I'd argue, it was not even great. But, I enjoyed it. I recognize how important it is, and I see a lot of low-key smart design choices that improved the game, but I'm mostly hoping for its seuqel to push the potential of this first entry to higher highs. And based on what I heard, it did.

Don’t let the graphics fool you this game is a masterpiece, the Half-Life series in general is a masterpiece and this is what you should start with obviously. This game is so fun and this game right now is 23 years old, it’s amazing how this game made with the Quake 1 Engine and is 2 decades old and is still better than most games that come out today. So if you haven’t played this yet please play this, I promise you won’t regret it :)

I've just recently completed what many consider one of the all time first person shooter classics. This game, like DOOM and System Shock before it, refined the model for modern for fps's. The gameplay is very well made and enjoyable. I did, however experience one major glitch during my game. Every time I  would start the game from my desktop, I'd receive a warning that steam cloud failed to backup my saves. I thought nothing of it until one day near the end of the story, I discovered half my saves (the most recent half) missing. I solved the issue by using console commands to load the level I was really on. So I'm glad I didn't have to restart the whole game, but very frustrated that I had to go through the trouble. I really hope the same issue doesn't occur for Opposing Forces and Blue Shift. My other negative isn't much a negative as it is a lack of a positive. The story in this game compared to System Shock 2 and even the original System Shock, is extremely lackluster, leaving this game to rely almost entirely on the gameplay. I won't say any more except that I hope the DLC and/or sequels improve on this aspect.

Played this game for the first time in early 2000, so not that long after it came out. First shown it by a friend whilst staying over and loved it straight away. Got it for myself and the rest is history. Love this series and have played or at the very least seen every entry multiple times, the only reason I have waited so long to own it on Steam ( and Steam itself) is that I have only just been able to get my actual own PC. This was a no questions asked first buy.  If you are new to this you may find it dated obviously from a technical point of view, but experience it for what it is and find out why it gets the acknowledgement it has.
